issue.title: expressvpn.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.20.3

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

https://www.expressvpn.com/kr/what-is-my-ip

issue.title: Potential Solution for Peacock Ads

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Ads have recently started making their way through Peacock, and seem to have been for many users.

### Proposed solution

The following rules have successfully blocked all ads on Peacock (so far):
```
||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-*.cdn.peacocktv.com  # blocks all ads
@@||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-mc.cdn.peacocktv.com  # seems to allow the main content to come through.
```

Would love some feedback on if this works for anyone else.

### Additional information

Thanks to [this list of domains](https://gist.github.com/ozankiratli/801ba17705e7f2a904d2e443af5a64f8#peacock) curated by @ozankiratli as the base of this solution.

comment.body: @mrrobotnic Did you make sure the second rule is an allow rule? Mine did what you are describing until I made that specific pattern an allow.

issue.title: Potential Solution for Peacock Ads

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Ads have recently started making their way through Peacock, and seem to have been for many users.

### Proposed solution

The following rules have successfully blocked all ads on Peacock (so far):
```
||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-*.cdn.peacocktv.com  # blocks all ads
@@||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-mc.cdn.peacocktv.com  # seems to allow the main content to come through.
```

Would love some feedback on if this works for anyone else.

### Additional information

Thanks to [this list of domains](https://gist.github.com/ozankiratli/801ba17705e7f2a904d2e443af5a64f8#peacock) curated by @ozankiratli as the base of this solution.

comment.body: @alechouse97 I am pretty sure it was as I copy and pasted right out of the code box, but I will absolutely try putting it in again into the AdGuard custom filtering rules and will report back.  Thank you.
